snippet: A House of Commons committee unanimously called for legislation that would punish people linked to human rights abuses by denying them travel visas and freezing their financial assets.
abstract: House of Commons committee in Great Britain unanimously calls for legislation that would punish people linked to human rights abuses by denying them travel visas and freezing their financial assets; proposed legislation is named for Sergei L Magnitsky, who died in prison in Russia after he was repeatedly denied medical care, prompting international criticism of Russia’s human rights record.
lead_paragraph: A House of Commons committee unanimously called for legislation that would punish people linked to human rights abuses by denying them travel visas and freezing their financial assets.

headline.main: Britain: Bill Aims at Human Rights Violators
headline.print_headline: Britain: Bill Aims at Rights Violators

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
